intro: Gnaphalium alienum, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant with small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wetlands. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, giving them a woolly appearance. Gnaphalium alienum is known for its ability to produce a large number of small seeds, which are dispersed by the wind.
